dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, uh, big news this week, right? All eyes on the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, uh, big news this week, right? All eyes on the AstraZeneca C O V I D-nineteen vaccine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, absolutely. It's been quite the, um, rollercoaster, hasn't it? With all these reports swirling around about blood clots.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, absolutely. It's been quite the, um, rollercoaster, hasn't it? With all these reports swirling around about blood clots.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And now, like, countries are just, you know, pausing its use left and right. Germany just joined the list, after the Netherlands, Ireland, France...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And now, like, countries are just, you know, pausing its use left and right. Germany just joined the list, after the Netherlands, Ireland, France...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Germany on Monday became the latest country to pause use of the vaccine... The Netherlands announced on Sunday that the use of the AstraZeneca jab will be suspended... Ireland also temporarily suspended the use of the shots... Apart from the Netherlands and Ireland, Denmark, Norway, Iceland and Thailand have also temporarily suspended rollout of the vaccine...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, and Denmark, Norway, Iceland, Thailand too, I think? It's becoming, like, a pretty long list of precautionary measures.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and Denmark, Norway, Iceland, Thailand too, I think? It's becoming, like, a pretty long list of precautionary measures.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apart from the Netherlands and Ireland, Denmark, Norway, Iceland and Thailand have also temporarily suspended rollout of the vaccine while Austria has stopped using a particular batch of the shots.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the Dutch Health Minister, Hugo de Jonge, he basically said, "Look, we can't allow any doubts about the vaccine." Even if there's no direct proof *yet*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the Dutch Health Minister, Hugo de Jonge, he basically said, Look, we can't allow any doubts about the vaccine. Even if there's no direct proof yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While no cases of blood clotting were reported in the Netherlands, there was no proof yet of a direct link between the vaccine and blood clots, Dutch Health Minister Hugo de Jonge said, adding: We cant allow any doubts about the vaccine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is fair, I mean, you don't want to erode public trust. But, um, even AstraZeneca itself, after reviewing safety data from over 10 million vaccinated people...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is fair, I mean, you don't want to erode public trust. But, um, even AstraZeneca itself, after reviewing safety data from over ten million vaccinated people...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Insisting its vaccine is safe, AstraZeneca said it had reviewed safety data of more than 17 million people vaccinated in the European Union and the U.K.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They found evidence of an *increased risk*, right? Of things like pulmonary embolism, deep vein thrombosis, or thrombocytopenia. That's, uh, that's pretty significant coming from them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They found evidence of an increased risk, right? Of things like pulmonary embolism, deep vein thrombosis, or thrombocytopenia. That's, uh, that's pretty significant coming from them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Insisting its vaccine is safe, AstraZeneca said it had reviewed safety data of more than 17 million people vaccinated in the European Union and the U.K. and found no evidence of an increased risk of pulmonary embolism, deep vein thrombosis or thrombocytopenia, in any defined age group, gender, batch or in any particular country, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. Though they were quick to add it wasn't, like, specific to any age group, gender, or batch, which is interesting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. Though they were quick to add it wasn't, like, specific to any age group, gender, or batch, which is interesting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and found no evidence of an increased risk of pulmonary embolism, deep vein thrombosis or thrombocytopenia, in any defined age group, gender, batch or in any particular country, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then you have the World Health Organization, with Dr. Soumya Swaminathan, their Chief Scientist, saying, "It remains unclear if the vaccine is causing the blood clots."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then you have the World Health Organization, with Doctor Soumya Swaminathan, their Chief Scientist, saying, It remains unclear if the vaccine is causing the blood clots.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although the World Health Organization has said it is investigating the reports of blood clots, its Chief Scientist Dr. Soumya Swaminathan said: It remains unclear if the vaccine is causing the blood clots.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and she made a really good point, actually, that just because an adverse event is reported *after* vaccination doesn't automatically mean it's *because* of the vaccination. Things, you know, happen naturally in the population.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and she made a really good point, actually, that just because an adverse event is reported after vaccination doesn't automatically mean it's because of the vaccination. Things, you know, happen naturally in the population.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She then added: The adverse events which are reported after vaccination have to be seen in the context of events which occur naturally in the population. Just because its reported following a vaccination doesnt mean that its because of the vaccination. It could be completely unrelated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But then, on the flip side, the European Medicines Agency, the EMA, they did a preliminary probe and found *some indication* that the vaccine might have caused the clotting in at least one case in Austria.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then, on the flip side, the European Medicines Agency, the E M A, they did a preliminary probe and found some indication that the vaccine might have caused the clotting in at least one case in Austria.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Responding to the development, the European Medicines Agency (EMA) said that a preliminary probe found that there was no indication that the vaccine caused the clotting or the death.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, it's just, uh, a lot of conflicting information, isn't it? And you can really see how this is, like, denting public confidence. I mean, German authorities are reportedly *pleading* with people to take the vaccine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, it's just, uh, a lot of conflicting information, isn't it? And you can really see how this is, like, denting public confidence. I mean, German authorities are reportedly pleading with people to take the vaccine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the flip flop and bad press has dented public confidence in the shot which has forced German authorities to plead with people to take the vaccine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which is, um, a tough spot to be in. Meanwhile, the US government just bought 15 million doses of the Moderna vaccine. That's a big number.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is, um, a tough spot to be in. Meanwhile, the U S government just bought fifteen million doses of the Moderna vaccine. That's a big number.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 30 million. Thats the number of doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine that the U.S. government has purchased, the New York Times reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it really highlights that, you know, there are other options out there. But the AstraZeneca jab is still so crucial for global vaccine efforts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it really highlights that, you know, there are other options out there. But the AstraZeneca jab is still so crucial for global vaccine efforts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. So, it's a developing story, clearly. We'll, uh, have to keep an eye on it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. So, it's a developing story, clearly. We'll, uh, have to keep an eye on it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Lots more to, like, unpack next time, I'm sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Lots more to, like, unpack next time, I'm sure.
